Title: 🔥 WAR FIELD 🔥The online first-person shooter game you play to win real crypto!
Body: The WAR FIELD business model is like no other gaming business model. It combines the best of classical game economics with the advantages of the new world of cryptocurrency. The WAR FIELD game is built around the GLDR coin, which is the basic element of WAR FIELD economics. GLDR is both an ERC20-compliant cryptographic token that runs on the Ethereum blockchain and an in-game digital currency that can be used to purchase digital goods for use within the game.

Author: WARFIELD
Title: 🔥 WAR FIELD 🔥The online first-person shooter game you play to win real crypto!
Body: WAR FIELD is a fully-functional, action-packed multiplayer first-person shooter game with a blockchain-driven gaming economy that uses tradeable Ethereum-based cryptographic GLDR Tokens you can buy, sell, trade, and win for skilful play. In this game of “kill or be killed”, there’s a price on your head in real cryptocurrency. Real stakes heighten the intensity and mean skilled players get real rewards. Every player is required to choose an amount of GLDR tokens to stake on his or her life. This amount represents an initial “Life Cost”. When “injured” in gameplay, a player loses (surrenders) a certain amount of the GLDR (s)he has staked. A player gains GLDR from another player by “injuring” or “killing” that player. Every “hit” from a bullet or other weapon causes “injury” to a player's character and a certain amount of GLDR is transferred to the player who has caused the “injury”. If the balance of GLDR a player has staked as his or her or “Life Cost” reaches zero, the player’s character “dies”. In the event of “death”, gear that a player has purchased is not forfeited. It remains with the player and can be used for new “Lives”. WAR FIELD matches players based on skills and equipment to ensure fair chances for all. Battlegrounds according to their level of skill, weapons, and other hardware. This allows for a balance among players and prevents experienced players from disproportionately dominating new ones.
